page.title: 04PATTERNS OF EMPLOYMENT
page.content: From a small, but representative sample of questionnaires we found that very few people from the village actually worked in South Cerney itself. They mostly worked in Swindon or Cirencester, travelling by car, a distance of between 4 and 16 miles each way. However, most people did feel that they would have liked to work in the village, had there been opportunity to do so. Some of those interviewed were dentists, teachers and policemen and the others were employed in small firms or service industries. Few would welcome additional industry in South Cerney, since this would be detrimental to its atmosphere, though an increase in shopping facilities, with a resultant increase in employ- ment, would be welcomed by many.
